Class SmtpConnection

java.lang.Object
  SmtpConnection

public class SmtpConnection
extends java.lang.Object

The SmtpSendMessge class provides an interface to send messages to a host using the standard SMTP protocol

Version:
1.0a Date: 2008-06-15 Email: molcsan@mscd.edu
Author:
Ken Molcsan

Method Detail

send

public void send(java.lang.String h,
                 java.lang.String f,
                 java.lang.String t,
                 java.lang.String m)
Purpose: The send command will open a connection to the supplied SMTP host, and call the sendMessage method with the supplied parameters to transmit the message. Upon completion, the connection will be closed.

Parameters:
h - host - the host server name/ip address
f - from - the address of the message sender
t - to - the address of the message recipient
m - message - the message content to be sent
See Also:
nothing

sendMessage

private void sendMessage(java.lang.String f,
                         java.lang.String t,
                         java.lang.String m)
Purpose: The sendMessage method will send the appropriate SMTP commands to the host to transmit the message.

Parameters:
f - from - the address of the message sender
t - to - the address of the message recipient
m - message - the message content to be sent
See Also:
nothing

dotEscapeMsg

private java.lang.String dotEscapeMsg(java.lang.String message)
Purpose: The dotEscapeMsg method will properly analyze the message string passed, and will replace all occurrences of . with .. to allow the full message to be transmitted.

Parameters:
m - message - the message content to be sent
Returns:
String Escaped message will be returned and will be appended with the final . to signal the completion of the message.
See Also:
nothing

openConnection

private boolean openConnection(java.lang.String h)
Purpose: The openConnection method will return true if the requested connection was established. Otherwise the method will return false

Parameters:
h - host - the host server name/ip address
Returns:
Boolean True = success, False = failure;
See Also:
nothing

closeConnection

private void closeConnection()
Purpose: The closeConnection method will send the "QUIT" command to the connected server, and will discard any existing connection references which may be reused for future message commands.

See Also:
nothing

sendCmd

private boolean sendCmd(java.lang.String command)
Purpose: The sendCmd method provides the common interface to the connected SMTP server. When called, it will send the command parameter passed, and read the response from the SMTP server.

Parameters:
command - SMTP command to be sent to the SMTP host.
Returns:
Boolean True = successful; False = failure;
See Also:
nothing
